name: Euler's Identity
explanation: Leonhard Euler's beautiful equation connects five fundamental mathematical constants: e (base of natural logarithms), i (imaginary unit), π (pi), 1, and 0. This equation is considered one of the most elegant in mathematics because it unifies algebra, geometry, trigonometry, and complex analysis. It's a special case of Euler's formula: e^(ix) = cos(x) + i sin(x), when x = π.

examples.solution: Using Euler's formula: e^(iπ) = cos(π) + i sin(π) = -1 + 0i = -1
steps: Euler's formula: e^(ix) = cos(x) + i sin(x)

proof: Euler's formula e^(ix) = cos(x) + i sin(x) can be derived from Taylor series expansions: e^(ix) = Σ(ix)^n/n! = cos(x) + i sin(x). Setting x = π gives e^(iπ) = -1.
